abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Protected Area Project
            for Cote d'Ivoire were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            dependency on parallel funding to achieve significant
            outcomes is an important risk factor to be addressed.
            Conventional livelihood micro projects are not the only
            elements to be considered to achieve community engagement in
            park management as long as such engagement measures generate
            direct benefits to communities. Projects in post-conflict
            countries need detailed situation and risk analysis.
            Performance of projects can be improved through
            incentive-based arrangements for governmental servants.
